title: Nic’s Fancy Baked Potatoes
ingredients:
2 tbsp butter
4 cloves garlic
3 rashers bacon (optional)
1 tbs seeded mustard (optional)
2 tbs flour
2 cups milk
2 tsp salt
1 tsp pepper
about 10 potatoes - depends on size, I guess 
1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
1 round of camembert cheese
method: In a small pot melt butter, fry garlic until it’s just starting to brown.
Whisk until there are no lumps.
Slowly drizzle in milk whilst constantly whisking to make sure the mixture is smooth.
Bring to boil and then remove from heat.
Put a round ovenproof bowl the size of the camembert in the centre of the baking dish/bowl.
Slice potatoes thinly and position sitting upwards around the small bowl.
Pour the sauce over the top and bake until potatoes are tender in centre.
If tops are getting too brown, cover with foil to finish cooking.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with parmesan, remove the bowl and add the camembert.
Put back in the oven for another 5-10 minutes.
Note: not suitable for any sort of weightwatcher’s menu.
